results.title: Real maths and school maths: can we close the gap?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Bill Newton presents students in Years 4 and 5 demonstrating their ability with a school maths problem and an everyday problem involving the calculation of change when buying chocolate.

results.title: Indonesian cuisine
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Focusing on a family of Indonesian immigrants and their Indonesian student guest, this program shows how Indonesians in Australia seek to preserve their culture through their cuisine and through cultural events which demonstrate their music, dress and customs.

results.title: Western Samoa: the best of both worlds?
results.brief_description: Explores the changes occuring in Western Samoa which give young people the choice between the “modern” world of the capital city, Alpia and traditional village life. Explains how each family member has a particular role to perform within the structured village society.

results.title: Wasantha: 18 years
results.creator_credit: Chris Foss, Norsk Rikskringkasting and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Wasantha is an 18 year old Sri Lankan school girl who, in addition to her family responsibilities, is a voluntary health worker in a government run clinic.

results.title: The Urban challenge: learning a living
results.creator_credit: Edward King, William Hetzer, UNICEF and University of the State of New York
results.brief_description: Examines the plight of the urban poor in the USA, Thailand and Peru. Shows how in low income communities, opportunities for learning can be expected beyond school walls. Self-help community development projects, on-the-job training and professional guidance are organized to both increase literacy and to help people achieve a secure and rewarding life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward King, William Hetzer, UNICEF and University of the State of New York

results.title: UNICEF: the first forty years
results.brief_description: Presents a comprehensive history of UNICEF since its formation in 1946 to the present day. Catalogues its worth in the developing countries and indicates its success in various projects to improve the health, nutrition and social development of millions of people. No other credits available.

results.title: Oman today: the challenge
results.brief_description: Since the early seventies Oman has been involved in a development process that began with the opening of the country to the modern world. The role of UNICEF and other agencies, as well as specialists from other Arab countries is outlined.

results.title: Deciding a future
results.creator_credit: Edward King, William Hetzer and UNICEF
results.brief_description: UNICEF believes that a well organized and involved community that mobilizes itself for a change is performing a needed activity. This program shows how community participation has become an active means of development in Lima, Bangkok and New York.

results.title: Child's horizon
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of UNICEF in attempting to counter some of the causes of blindness in children: malnutrition, cataracts, infections and accidents. Also highlights factors that agravate the spread of disease - Poverty, ignorance, crowded living conditions, lack of clear water and poor sanitation.
